messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: REPORT: 630-8910-Z DATE: 08/18/23  On August 18, around 11:00 AM, Officer A. B. Coleman was dispatched to a hit-and-run incident at 210 Birch Avenue. Witnesses pointed out the fleeing vehicle's direction to Patrol Officer C. D. Ellis, who immediately pursued.  Upon reaching the scene, Sergeant E. F. Green documented the surroundings. The victim, Mr. Mitchell, was tended to by Dr. Hannah Finley, a passing medical doctor who happened to be nearby.  Homicide Detective I. J. Harper was called in due to the severity of the injuries. Detective Harper contacted Criminalist K. L. Morgan to analyze tire tracks and other forensic evidence.  The case saw involvement from Lieutenant M. N. Owen, who reviewed security footage from surrounding establishments. Captain O. P. Perry provided additional resources to expedite the investigation.  All evidence gathered should be sent to the CRIME SCENE INVESTIGATION DIVISION. NOTIFY: Detective Harper, Lieutenant Owen, Officer Coleman, Criminalist Morgan, and Sergeant Green.  CASE DETAILS:  Security Footage Witness Testimonies Forensic Evidence Vehicle Descriptions Medical Report CONTACT FOR MORE INFO: SHIFT COMMANDER Q. R. Smith S.P.D. 360-923 C3C 9112 Mitchell, JAMES ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 312-8590 OFFICER: A. B. Coleman CASE: 630-8010- 630 ACCIDENT: 11:00 CASE ID 79213 - FILED Lucy Thompson DATE 08/20/23 SEND TO: CSI DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Officer A. B. Coleman  
Officer Context: On August 18, around 11:00 AM, Officer A. B. Coleman was dispatched to a hit-and-run incident at 210 Birch Avenue.  
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer C. D. Ellis  
Officer Context: Witnesses pointed out the fleeing vehicle's direction to Patrol Officer C. D. Ellis, who immediately pursued.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Green  
Officer Context: Upon reaching the scene, Sergeant E. F. Green documented the surroundings.  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Homicide Detective I. J. Harper  
Officer Context: Homicide Detective I. J. Harper was called in due to the severity of the injuries.  
Officer Role: Homicide Detective 

Officer Name: Criminalist K. L. Morgan  
Officer Context: Detective Harper contacted Criminalist K. L. Morgan to analyze tire tracks and other forensic evidence.  
Officer Role: Criminalist 

Officer Name: Lieutenant M. N. Owen  
Officer Context: The case saw involvement from Lieutenant M. N. Owen, who reviewed security footage from surrounding establishments.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Captain O. P. Perry  
Officer Context: Captain O. P. Perry provided additional resources to expedite the investigation.  
Officer Role: Captain
